item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves adds Gato
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/fatal-fury-city-of-the-wolves-adds-gato

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

While no longer blind, he chooses to fight in complete darkness.

SNK has released a new trailer for Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves featuring playable character Gato (voiced by Cory Yee in English, Yuma Yamaguchi in Japanese).

Here is his character description, via SNK:

Gato, who was blinded by his father’s vicious attack in a previous tournament, will be returning to Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves as a playable character. Gato has mostly regained his sight since the brutal attack, but realizing that very sight has limited him to slower movements, he now chooses to fight in complete darkness. Upon hearing about the upcoming King of Fighters tournament, the vengeful fighter steps back into the arena, fixated on settling the score with his father.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in early 2025.

Watch the trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Gato Trailer

Japanese

item.title: Octopath Traveler series shipments and digital sales top five million
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/octopath-traveler-series-shipments-and-digital-sales-top-five-million

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Series currently on sale on digital stores.

Total shipments and digital sales for the Octopath Traveler series have surpassed five million units, Square Enix announced.

To celebrate the milestone, both Octopath Traveler and Octopath Traveler II are currently on sale on digital marketplaces at 60 percent- and 50 percent-off discount prices, respectively, until January 7, 2025.

Square Enix also released a commemorative illustration by Rika Okazaki:

Octopath Traveler launched for Switch on July 13, 2018, followed by PC on June 7, 2019, and Stadia on April 28, 2020, and surpassed 2.5 million shipments and digital sales in February 2021. An Xbox One version launched on March 25, 2021, followed by PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on June 5, 2024.

Octopath Traveler II launched for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC on February 24, 2023, and surpassed one million shipments and digital sales in June 2023. Xbox Series and Xbox One versions launched on June 5, 2024.
